description: Designed and maintained components of a high-fidelity, large-scale distributed SITL radio communications simulation, driving feature development and system reliability improvements.
Redesigned database schema with synthetic sharding to resolve a multi-year data loss issue, achieving 10x write throughput at 30,000+ writes/sec with improved read latency through parallel queries.
Built a data ingestion platform with automatic Protobuf schema inference and database table evolution, eliminating manual schema management for multiple independent services.

Developed a high-throughput CLI tool for migrating data between database clusters, reducing migration time from hours to minutes for multi-million row datasets, replacing a legacy process that previously took days.

Implemented a distributed network monitoring application using active UDP probing to record real-time packet loss and latency across WAN and ad-hoc tactical networks, providing situational awareness during field tests and enabling post-flight performance reporting.

Developed an AFSIM plugin modeling high-fidelity communications link behavior (including latency, packet loss, and routing) across simulated platforms in contested environments, delivering higher-fidelity comms capabilities to an internal customer.
Owned end-to-end software release pipelines across multiple projects, leveraging Jenkins CI/CD and Ansible automation to build and distribute RPM and DEB packages cross-platform.

Developed a Raspberry Pi-based field test device integrating IMU, GPS, and PPS sensors; configured as a Stratum 1 time server with time-series data logging and statistics collection from equipment under test.
Developed a configuration files linter, used in CI/CD Jenkins pipelines
Implemented health monitoring for a distributed simulation system
Built a dry run functionality to test components are ready to run
Team leader in autonomous drone competition
